permafrost.tundra.lang

Class StringHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • permafrost.tundra.lang.StringHelper

  • public class StringHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of convenience methods for working with String objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Disallow instantiation of this class.

        string - The string to quote.
        Returns:
        A regular expression pattern which literally matches the given string.

      • quote

        public static java.lang.String quote(java.lang.String[] array)
        Returns a regular expression pattern that matches any of the values in the given string list.
        Parameters:
        array - The list of strings to be matched.
        Returns:
        A regular expression which literally matches any of the given strings.

      • pad

        public static java.lang.String pad(java.lang.String string,
                                   int length,
                                   char character)
        Pads a string with the given character to the given length.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to pad.
        length - The desired length of the string. If less than 0 the string is padded right to left, otherwise it is padded from left to right.
        character - The character to pad the string with.
        Returns:
        The padded string.

      • pad

        public static java.lang.String[] pad(java.lang.String[] input,
                                     int length,
                                     char character)
        Pads each string in the given list with the given character to the given length.
        Parameters:
        input - The list of strings to be padded.
        length - The desired length of the strings. If less than 0 the strings are padded right to left, otherwise they are padded from left to right.
        character - The character to pad the strings with.
        Returns:
        The list of padded strings.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String string1,
                          java.lang.String string2)
        Compares two strings lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        string1 - The first string to compare.
        string2 - The second string to compare.
        Returns:
        Less than 0 if the first string is less than the second string, equal to 0 if the two strings are equal, or greater than 0 if the first string is greater than the second string.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String string1,
                          java.lang.String string2,
                          boolean caseInsensitive)
        Compares two strings lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        string1 - The first string to compare.
        string2 - The second string to compare.
        caseInsensitive - Whether the comparison should be case insensitive.
        Returns:
        Less than 0 if the first string is less than the second string, equal to 0 if the two strings are equal, or greater than 0 if the first string is greater than the second string.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String string1,
                          java.lang.String string2,
                          boolean caseInsensitive,
                          boolean whitespaceInsensitive)
        Compares two strings lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        string1 - The first string to compare.
        string2 - The second string to compare.
        caseInsensitive - Whether the comparison should be case insensitive.
        whitespaceInsensitive - Whether the comparison should be whitespace insensitive.
        Returns:
        Less than 0 if the first string is less than the second string, equal to 0 if the two strings are equal, or greater than 0 if the first string is greater than the second string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData scope)
        Returns a formatted string using the specified pattern and arguments.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from the record and normalized to the specified types.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData scope,
                                      int index)
        Returns a formatted string using the specified pattern and arguments.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from the record and normalized to the specified types.
        index - The zero-based array index for this record if it is part of a list that is being formatted.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData pipeline,
                                      com.wm.data.IData scope)
        Returns a formatted string using the specified pattern and arguments.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        pipeline - The pipeline against which absolute argument keys are resolved.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from the record and normalized to the specified types.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData pipeline,
                                      com.wm.data.IData scope,
                                      int index)
        Returns a formatted string using the specified pattern and arguments.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        pipeline - The pipeline against which absolute argument keys are resolved.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from the record and normalized to the specified types.
        index - The zero-based array index for this record if it is part of a list that is being formatted.

        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      java.lang.String recordSeparator,
                                      com.wm.data.IData... records)
        Returns a formatted string produced by formatting each given record using the specified pattern and arguments, separated by the given separator string.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from each record and normalized to the specified types.
        recordSeparator - An optional string for separating each formatted record in the resulting string.
        records - An IData[] document list where each item contains a set of argument values.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData pipeline,
                                      java.lang.String recordSeparator,
                                      com.wm.data.IData... records)
        Returns a formatted string produced by formatting each given record using the specified pattern and arguments, separated by the given separator string.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from each record and normalized to the specified types.
        pipeline - The pipeline against which absolute argument keys are resolved.
        recordSeparator - An optional string for separating each formatted record in the resulting string.
        records - An IData[] document list where each item contains a set of argument values.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • nullify

        public static java.lang.String nullify(java.lang.String input)
        Returns null if the given string only contains whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be nullified.
        Returns:
        Null if the given string only contains whitespace characters, otherwise the given string unmodified.

      • nullify

        public static java.lang.String nullify(java.lang.String input,
                                       boolean nullify)
        Returns null if the given string only contains whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be nullified.
        nullify - If true, the string will be nullified.
        Returns:
        Null if the given string only contains whitespace characters, otherwise the given string unmodified.

      • nullify

        Converts each string in the given list to null if it only contains whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        input - The string list to be nullified.
        Returns:
        The nullified list of strings.
